availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elihu Webber (Owsley County, Kentucky farmer and soldier)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Turzah Nowland Webber on August 6, 1858. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860. Private and Corporal in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) for three years.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 65. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Owsley County Marriages, p. unknown. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Beatyville, p. 75. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Arkansas, Franklin County, White Oak, p. 116. Find A Grave, “Elihu Webber (1833-1869),” Memorial #138596073, http://findagrave.com/memorial/138596073 (accessed March 5, 2018). National Park Service, Soldiers and Sailors Database, "Elihu Webber," https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-soldiers-detail.htm?soldierId=4F33B4DD-DC7A-DF11-BF36-B8AC6F5D926A. Franklin County, Arkansas Probate Court, Probate Records, 1838-1967, Ancestry, Administrator’s Bond, 1870, p. 73.
